value.description: A synthetic stimulant. Wake-up fills the user's need for rest, allowing them to work for extended periods without getting tired. However, taking wake-up runs the risk of developing an addiction.\n\nIn the most competitive universities and companies of many worlds, high-achievers are sometimes called 'wake-ups' because of the association with this drug.
Wake-up pervades the bloodstream, filling the need for rest by stimulating the brain, and increases focus, allowing faster work. It also increases the psyfocus gains from meditation.
Because of a wake-up addiction, this person needs to regularly consume the drug to avoid withdrawal symptoms.

A chemical addiction to wake-up. Long-term presence of wake-up has caused neurological adaptations at the cellular level, so the brain can no longer function properly without the drug. \nWithout regular doses of wake-up, withdrawal symptoms will begin. However, extended abstinence will force the brain to adapt back to its normal state, resolving the addiction.
I feel disoriented and tired. I seriously need a nap.
A built-up tolerance to wake-up. The more severe this tolerance is, the more wake-up it takes to get the same effect.
